item.title: Refresher on Security Labels
item.description:
Session Description

Following from the Security Labels for Covid Apps session at the 2020 Open Security Summit and in preparation for the Security Labels & Schrems II happening on Thursday this session will focus on :

  • Concept of ‘Security Labels’ and how it can be used in practice
  • Past examples of Security Labels efforts
  • Security Labels as a way to prevent ‘Markets for Lemons’
  • Labels to use during Security Labels & Schrems II session

References

  • Security Labels for Covid Apps at 2020 Open Security Summit
  • Security Labels & Schrems II

item.title: Security Labels & Schrems II
item.description:
Session Description

As per the Schrems II ruling the US is no longer an adequate country for EU personal data. BCS recently did a recent webinar on the legal aspects here [https://www.bcs.org/content-hub/webinar-what-do-you-need-to-know-about-schrems-ii/].

So far, the ICO guidance in the UK is to map your data flows in preparation for further guidance. To help companies with this, this working session will be a joint event between the Open Security Summit and the BCS focussed on the data flows. We’ll be combining the legal aspects, with data labelling and threat modelling techniques, to produce an interactive event.
